headline: Tesla tumbles, US dollar surges: Market takeaways
summary: Yahoo Finance Markets Reporter Josh Schafer joins Josh Lipton on Asking for a Trend to review some takeaways from the trading day. Tesla (TSLA) shares slide after the electric vehicle maker reported fourth quarter delivery numbers that fell short of estimates. The surge of the US dollar (DX-Y.NYB) could be bad news for multinational companies that drove the S&P 500 (^GSPC) in the first three quarters of 2024. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Tesla's Q4 delivery miss suggests 'investor fatigue': Analyst
summary: Tesla (TSLA) reported fourth quarter deliveries of 495,570, falling short of Wall Street expectations and marking its first decline in annual deliveries in nearly a decade. William Blair Group head of energy and sustainability research Jed Dorsheimer joins Market Domination to analyze the company's figures. Dorsheimer observes "investor fatigue" surrounding Tesla's latest offerings, including the Cybertruck and Models S and X. He notes that, while the Cybertruck's price is set to decrease, it remains "a very niche market" for that vehicle type, suggesting a limited impact on overall deliveries. He emphasizes that Tesla's success primarily stems from its more affordable offerings: the Model 3 and Model Y vehicles. "For Tesla to rebound from a volume perspective on the auto side of its business, we think it's really going to be the introduction of a Model 2 or hatchback," he tells Yahoo Finance.  Dorsheimer highlights "a silver lining" in Tesla's energy storage side and concludes, "Tesla has a lot of different tools in its toolbox, and we'll see how it plays out. I think longer term, they've clearly demonstrated the ability to show resilience." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Dow, stocks slide to start 2025 and extend losing streaks
summary: The US market averages (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) close the first trading day of 2025 in negative territory, their fifth straight session of losses. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell the most, dropping by 0.35%; the day's showing nearly breaking Wall Street's hopes for a last-minute Santa Claus rally. Market Domination Overtime host Julie Hyman examines several of 2024's top stock performers as they close out the first session of 2025. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Why Tesla (TSLA) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of electric vehicle pioneer Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) fell 5.1% in the morning session after the company reported underwhelming vehicle deliveries for Q4 2024. Total deliveries were 495,570 for Q4 2024, falling short of the consensus estimate of just under 507,000. Results for the quarter show the first annual drop in delivery numbers for the company, which reported 1.80 million deliveries in 2024 and 1.81 million deliveries in 2023.

Results for the quarter show the first annual drop in delivery numbers for the company, which reported 1.80 million deliveries in 2024 and 1.81 million deliveries in 2023.

headline: New Year’s Violence Rattles U.S.
summary: Law-enforcement officials say 42-year-old Shamsud-Din Jabbar intentionally drove into a large crowd in New Orleans, killing at least 15.  Deadly vehicle incidents in a pair of U.S. tourist hubs rattled the country at the start of the new year, as law enforcement warned of a heightened threat of extremism and violence ahead.  In New Orleans, investigators were still piecing together what led a 42-year-old U.S. veteran to ram a rented Ford pickup into a crowd of New Year’s Eve revelers on Bourbon Street, killing 15 in an attack authorities said was inspired by Islamic State.

raw.headline: New Year’s Violence Rattles U.S.
raw.summary: Law-enforcement officials say 42-year-old Shamsud-Din Jabbar intentionally drove into a large crowd in New Orleans, killing at least 15.  Deadly vehicle incidents in a pair of U.S. tourist hubs rattled the country at the start of the new year, as law enforcement warned of a heightened threat of extremism and violence ahead.  In New Orleans, investigators were still piecing together what led a 42-year-old U.S. veteran to ram a rented Ford pickup into a crowd of New Year’s Eve revelers on Bourbon Street, killing 15 in an attack authorities said was inspired by Islamic State.

headline: Tesla's Q4 deliveries disappoint, growth slows year over year
summary: Tesla (TSLA) reported its fourth quarter deliveries Thursday morning, with 495,570 vehicles delivered, falling short of analysts' expectations of 510,000 units. The electric vehicle maker's total 2024 deliveries reached 1.79 million, showing slowed growth compared to 2023's 1.808 million vehicles. Yahoo Finance Senior Auto Reporter Pras Subramanian joins Brad Smith and Madison Mills on Morning Brief and analyzes these disappointing results and their implications for Tesla's market position. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: FBI investigates Cybertruck explosion outside Trump Las Vegas hotel
summary: A Tesla (TSLA) Cybertruck exploded outside of President-elect Donald Trump's Las Vegas hotel on New Year's Day. Coinciding with the New Orleans truck attack that killed 15 people, the FBI and other law enforcement agencies are investigating whether there are any connections to these two incidents. The Morning Brief's Brad Smith and Madison Mills report the latest news, noting that law enforcement officials currently believe the Cybertruck explosion was an isolated incident. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: One Dead After Cybertruck Explodes Outside Trump Hotel in Las Vegas
summary: Police said that a Tesla Cybertruck explosion outside of the Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas killed one person and injured seven others.  A Tesla Cybertruck loaded with canisters of gas and firework mortars exploded in front of Trump International Hotel in Las Vegas Wednesday, killing one person and injuring seven others, authorities said.  The Cybertruck pulled up to the hotel front doors around 8:40 a.m. local time, according to Sheriff Kevin McMahill of the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department.
